metadata.title: CVE-2020-35111 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
When an extension with the proxy permission registered to receive<all_urls>, the proxy.onRequest callback was not triggered for view-sourceURLs. While web content cannot navigate to such URLs, a user opening ViewSource could have inadvertently leaked their IP address. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 84, Thunderbird < 78.6, and Firefox ESR < 78.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
